message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.CE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a unified model with Bayesian network structure to learn representations of products and customers for personalized recommendation. It also uses dual product embeddings to capture the intrinsic properties of complementariness. 

It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the paper focuses on modeling item complementariness and user preferences from purchase data, which is essential for personalized recommendation. 

Additionally, it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper proposes a machine learning model for personalized recommendation. 

It could also belong to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as the paper considers the buy-also-buy patterns among products and customer-specific bias in purchase data. 

Finally, it could belong to cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) as the paper proposes a novel ranking criterion based on product and customer embeddings for personalized recommendation.
